page.title: 18CHICHESTER-THE BARRACKS
page.content: Built in 1803/4 this British Army establishment has had an interesting history. It has held prisoners at various times, the most recent being Commander Astiz the only prisoner of the {Falklands Campaign '83. }Cavalry, infantry and the {Royal West Sussex {Regiment }have all been based here. It was named {Roussillon} to commemorate the association with the Royal West Sussex Regiment and their exploits at the Battle of Quebec .In 1964 it was occupied by the{ Royal Military Police and is now their U.K.Training Centre. Initial and Further Training are given in all aspects of police work. The Close Protection Wing provides bodyguards for certain V.I.P.s. {The Museum of the Corps of the R.M.P. reopened here in'85 & houses a history & an up to date account of the work of this branch of the British Army.
